info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 3 at 8:32PM CDT until April 7 at 5:17PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Missouri...
Current River near Powder Mill affecting Shannon County.
Roubidoux Creek Near Waynesville affecting Pulaski County.
Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood -East Gate affecting Pulaski County.
Jacks Fork at Alley Spring affecting Shannon County.
Jacks Fork at Eminence affecting Shannon County.
James River near Boaz affecting Stone and Christian Counties.
James River at Galena affecting Stone County.
Gasconade River at Jerome affecting Phelps County.
Gasconade River at Hazelgreen affecting Pulaski and Laclede Counties.
North Fork White River near Tecumseh affecting Ozark County.
For the Current River...including Powder Mill...flooding is possible. For the Big Piney River...including Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate... flooding is possible. For the Jacks Fork River...including Alley Spring, Eminence... flooding is possible. For the James River...including Galena, Boaz...flooding is possible. For the Gasconade River...including Jerome, Hazelgreen...flooding is possible. For the North Fork White River...including Tecumseh...flooding is possible.
* WHAT...Flooding is possible.
* WHERE...Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate.
* WHEN...From Friday evening to Monday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, major Flood Stage. The Fort Leonard Wood Golf Course floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 3.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1145 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO MONDAY AFTERNOON
